No. Lauren, the girl at this Comfort Inn front desk, just seemed uninterested in booking my room; In fact, my 'time' with her would show she's not interested in much regarding customer service! After booking my $104 room online , I called for a airport shuttle pick up. I told her where I was and she asked again.. so, with that I offered to go to arrivals ? or wherever .. she was snippy with every response. I am not quite sure what I did wrong as a customer asking where to be picked up .. BUT. She wasn't having any part of being friendly .. In fact, on the 4th call an hour later , as STILL waited for the shuttle I had now seen blast past where she told me to , 'stay put' and as she had said , ' just so you know ... we pick up in arrivals' .. Again, all she had to do was advise me of that when I called to ask.. now she is schooling me in her curt tone. I was finally picked up, one hour and seven minutes after my initial call for a shuttle. Upon getting into the van, the driver was super apologetic and I was not real pleased, so I shared my experience , thus far , with Lauren. He proceeded to share the managers name and number with me. I was able to check in early, probably because I killed this girl with kindness upon check in. Guess the other poor people she seemed to hold hostage under her control in the lobby, weren't so lucky. Entering my room, I notice a smoke smell. It wasn't overwhelming , but it was definitely there. I was so afraid to call this girl and complain, I sprayed my own potpourri spray throughout and prayed I could deal with it for a night. The room is less than clean here. The carpet had a big circular wet spot in one area .. one towel had red or rust stains on it .. the ceiling was cracked in the corner. All this for a little more than $100?! Aren't I lucky ! 
Later I called down to add my Choice frequent stay number , well, once again, Miss Personality told me it was added. Well, again, she took no time to look. No late check out for the next day when I asked ; it was , 'No No No .. ' huff , huff , huff and NEVER a thank you. NOT ONCE. 
I've stayed here a few times before , the night staff is very nice , helpful and accommodating. Once the gentlemen working the desk walked me to the restaurant next door, just because. Well. Actually he grabbed 'to go' menus while there , so maybe that was it. The van drivers are nice and helpful , too. The breakfast is a nice touch and the housekeeping staff is also friendly and helpful.  
All in all , this hotel could be great as an airport hotel .; clean up the rooms and , of course, the attitude.

Love the hotel.. The location is awesome.. clean rooms.. maybe the decor needs a bit updating and refreshing.... quiet DEPENDING on where you are placed .. haha.. I've had rooms near the elevator.. not okay.. rooms near the stairwell.. and I will move from now on. AND last weekend I could hear the peeps above getting their love on for a long time.. (really..cmon.. I am with the wrong guys?!) ... I like the staff.. always friendly, efficient. The coffee bar downstairs has discounts for certain companies; I am glad mine is one ...and anyone else wanting a bomb buck sammy.. they will even make it to go on the fly .. reasonably priced .BUT only open til 2pm on Sundays... internet works pretty well.Truly dont like having to swipe the key for every floor .. I think one key per should do the trick. The gym is great  ...and the pub has good brews...

Cayton's is such a great place for gourmet burgers and awesome shakes, while overlooking the beautiful good course and desert at the Ritz Carlton. BUT, they also have other great entrees too!  Amberlee was an amazing waitress last weekend where we celebrated my husband's birthday! She even included an 'adult' shake for him and a happy birthday note later in our suite ! Cayton's is his favorite burger place in Arizona and he raves about the burgers here to everyone.. So I had to set up his birthday dinner to celebrate while staying at the Ritz Carlton on his surprise getaway! The birthday guy had the Beef Brisket Burger which is actually a beef burger piled with beef brisket .. yes,  it's a cardiologist' nightmare, but IF you only eat half,  as he did .. you are full! I had the Mushroom Burger and I added bacon and again.. only half was consumed! I also had a salad with house made bleu cheese to balance out the veggie to meat ratio ! Salads can be in small or large .. I got a small and it was still big! The burgers come with a choice of fries ( sweet potato or regular) or salad .. and you can choose to have a type of bun or cheese too. As usual , all was perfect and our burgers were juicy ; HUGE and filling ! The adult shakes are also very BIG and so sinful... and yes.. they can be done in virgin style too! There is a humidor for after dinner cigars and a great selection of wines and beers too. We love the patio here on the golf course too! I highly recommend a reservation particularly on weekends when there is a guitarist strumming on the great patio. Can't wait to come back again .. such a treat Thanks for a great night, Cayton's !

This is such a mixed review for me! I recently stayed at the hotel next door and the check in clerk said he would recommend the Philly Diner over the Denny's a few steps further. Since it was late and dark and this being not the best of areas , I opted for the Philly Diner. Upon entering I questioned my decision. There must have been no more than 4 people dining, in the weirdly lit , almost gray? quiet diner. There were more young wait staff than patrons, and they were sitting in various booths behind the cash register on their phones seemingly uninterested in my being there , standing waiting to place a to-go order. Yeah. I should have left after a good 5 minute stand where one guy told a waitress in the kitchen to come do my order. I waited another 3-5 minutes . WHY do I do that ?! This lady comes out, NO hello, she just stood and looked at me .. so I placed my order. Then she moves 20 feet with her back to me ... I don't know whether to follow her or stay put! She then says in a unfriendly, almost barking manner over her shoulder, 'I'll ring you up over here' .. and shakes her head at me. Yeah , because I read minds? Off she disappears to the kitchen again. A few minutes later what appears to be the owner or manager comes out and he greets me and asks if I am okay. Well, that is better! BUT then proceeds to argue with the young staff about who is off and who is staying to work. They argue back. This is actually getting humorous. The grumpy older lady appears with my food , and I ask about utinsels since I am in a hotel room. She snaps , ' I always put those in first!' Simmer down , sister. It's a basic question. 
The food: It was actually very good. I had a Turkey Melt and switched the cheese up. It was hot, seemingly fresh, and an ample serving that I could not finish.
It gets a 2 star because customer service is important. This place has so much potential and just fails in professionalism. That alone makes my return factor, meh. 
Know going in, that you will wait; possibly not be waited on , because what is on those waiters smart phones is clearly more important than doing the job you were hired to do; and when waited on, it may be nice or it may be the ' YOU are disturbing me!' factor. 
No. Thanks.

The Saint has a great few things going for it. And a few not so great things ... I am undecided on whether given the option , as to whether I would choose to stay here again. This time I was along for the ride with my Marriott Elite husband and his conference hotel was booked. Enter: The Saint. 

Pros: 
Location. You are on the corner of Canal Street and within 3-5 minutes of the French Quarter. 
South Beach trendy, upscale, artsy vibe ( Not very French Quarter , but I guess it depends on your taste!) 
Room was quiet ( on our floor) and large for NOLA
Wifi worked efficiently ( I rate this as a pro, because as a frequent traveler, THAT is not always the case!) 
Shower and bath large and very trendy and modern with nice toiletries 
Gym Clean; Quiet; Modern.. gets the job done 
GREAT Concierge to help with restaurants and hard to get reservations at hard to get times!
Room/Suite upgrades for Marriott Elites 
Marriott Gold/Platinum members get breakfast 
The Ritz Carlton... right next door for all the amenities missing here! INCLUDING a great jazz club called The Davenport..:-) 

Cons: 
Restaurant Tempt was NEVER open beyond breakfast in the 5 day span we were there. 
Room Service Non Existent
The Burgundy Bar was open towards end of week and seemed to make up their own hours; The service for not being busy was less than efficient or nice. It's beautiful and expansive .. we were confused. 
Valet.. very, very, VERY slow.. as in call an hour ahead to have your car waiting; This was almost a HUGE crisis for my husband who had conference and seminar times in another area of the city. 
Dark almost creepy blue lit halls 
LOUD lobby music ALL hours of the day.. SOBE vibe ( not NOLA) again.. hey it's all in the taste! 
No refrigerator and a super small mini cooler in room that won't fit a thing! Becomes an issue if your a foodie like me
who likes to eat the way thru a place like New Orleans and bring back food for later!! 

Return factor.. in the middle. It quite honestly depends on what other Marriott locations were available. This was not my favorite NOLA hotel but not my least favorite either. A few tweaks and it would be amazing ... a restaurant , room service , the bar is beautiful so WORK it! , Add a refrigerator to the rooms and for goodness sake change that crazy lighting ! Oh and tone down the untz untz untz music a little .. this is a jazz town and I'm not even old...

We recently spent our one year anniversary trip revisiting where we got married, minus the stress and the guests!  Wanting to go off of our resort for one night and enjoy one of our favorite foods/meals , we were lead to Le Rendezvous. Because we were staying at our wedding venue on Starr Pass, and were likely to have wine, we took an Uber. For a few minutes, I wondered where we were headed, but the lengthy trip was worth it! We were warmly greeted and seated in the dining room upon our arrival. The dining room is small and quaint and the Rat Pack crooned over the sound system adding a nice ambience. It was, our wedding reception music, after all!! Did they know?! There is a Yelp check in offer for a gratis glass of wine , but we opted for a French 75. This classic lemony martini topped with champagne was handshaken at our table.. the extra left in the martini shaker for us. Nice! I would not come close to finishing this drink and I knew pretty quickly that if I tried, I would be done. It was good, but it packed a punch!! The wine list, primarily French wines from all the various regions in France, was impressive! I spent several minutes trying to decide what would be my wine for dinner! Our server, was so gracious and friendly .. he knew the menu backwards and forwards and recommended dishes and wine to me when I was hung up on what to order. The menu is classic French but was missing Foie Gras, which I love ! He excused himself for a second and asked the chef if they could grant my wish: Voila! Wish granted! I ended up not going with the foie gras, after all of that, as my main was a Beef Wellington, which is rich and wrapped in foie gras. Can I ever just make my mind up ?! I started with the Salade de Epinard: a spinach Salad with carmelized sweet onions, chèvre , perfect crisps of lardons amongst the perfect Dijon vinagrette.. THIS could have been my main! I was quickly taken back to Cafe du Trocadero in Paris where I had this salad all the time ! My husband ordered the pate to start. This starter was a tremendous amount of pate! So rich and filling ! He also had the Gratin du Oignon, a steaming rich , bubbling gratin of French onion soup that was bubbling with delightful Guyere cheese on top. Next we both opted for the Beef Wellington. This isn't a dish that is often offered on menus and I've only seen it once , maybe?, in Phoenix .. so it's a treat, when prepared correctly. This Beef Wellington was an ample serving of filet , tucked amidst foie gras and baked rare within a perfect , flaky warm crust that was melt in your mouth heaven! Our dishes were served with crisp yet tender pomme des Annas, potatoes that were just perfectly crisp and seasoned and also vegetables to balance the meal. This Beef Wellington was outstanding and perfectly prepared! There was so much of it, and it's so rich , there was no way either of us could complete our meals. This wasn't your typical upscale meal, where the food is all about looking decorative and not a lot to eat; NO! These portions were a lot for a French , upscale restaurant! Next came out dessert, the waiter brought us a Grand Marnier Soufflé to share for our anniversary celebration ! The concierge at our wedding resort must have set that up! Literally, I've never seen a soufflé so puffy and perfect! It came with Chantilly Creme and again... so very French! This meal was one of my husbands and my favorites likely for the year... and as you can see from my reviews, we travel and we eat a lot!! I can't say enough about Le Rendezvous and how amazing the food was here! The entire experience was almost as perfect as it could be outside of France... even the waiter snapping at his helper was authentic! ( Yes! We could hear that from our table 'number 2' !! :-) ) Finding good , VERY good French food in Arizona is hard.. this is the place! Merci Beaucoup!!

Hands down Luke is one of the best happy hours in the French Quarter, and busy! We found ourselves here after waiting to check in at the Hilton on St. Charles Avenue just in time. Luke quickly filled up and at one time was 3 deep behind our coveted bar spot with patrons trying to get drink and 75 cent oyster orders in. Happy Hour runs from 3-6pm ; all specialty cocktails , wines and beers ate half off! It's a great time to sample a drink you may have been wanting to try, like the Sazerac or French 75, both N'awlins 'native' 'must try once drinks'. I love the French 75 here; unlike some other establishments, Luke creates this special concoction with no gin, just enough lemonade, atop a small cherry, bitters and champagne.. the attentive bartenders even swirl a ' 75' or a pink heart atop the goodness. We made this our go to hh spot during our week in Nola. Can't find a place at the bar, no worries, you can enjoy the great hh prices from a table; another rarity. Great cappuccinos, which the bartender even suggested I try a smooth shot of a liquor called 43 / Cuarenta y Tres with: SOLD. We sampled bubbles including a nice Pinot Noir bubbly from France. We opted for dinner here one night , as well. I highly recommend reservations because the place gets packed and seemed to stay that way. For dinner I had the crab bisque , the best I've had in Nola , believe it or not. I say that , because I like the bisque to have pieces of crab throughout, and this one did. For my entree, I had the ribeye with maitre de butter and topped with crab. The ribeye was tender, but fatty. The waiter offered to take it back , but I did love the flavor and ribeye is not a filet! It was good, so no need to take it away! A wonderful warm bread comes with the meal and the ambience is old French bistro and lively. John Besh is known for his amazingness in his home of New Orleans. We had just missed his being here at Luke.. maybe someday again, we will have the opportunity.. because we will def return!

This is a pretty large secondhand store on South Street, next to Repo Records. They have really good stuff in the windows all the time, and they have a very large selection of jackets. They have an entire rack of fur jackets (which my friend would not let me buy!) So if you are in the area, and want a fur jacket, go here! 

The jeans section is pretty good, and I saw some brand names like Lucky. Things are a little higher-priced here than Goodwill or the Salvation Army, but you won't have to dig through piles of clothes to find something cute. So you're paying for the time the staff of Retrospect has saved you by pre-sorting. I bought two fall jackets that would be appropriate for work (after some serious dry cleaning and slight stitching) for about $18 apiece.

Oh man, I've had more Gianna's food than most people in this world. My friend, the vegan, will drive here if we are even within a 50-mile radius of Gianna's. I swear. One time we were in Baltimore and he decided that was "close enough" and we came here. 

Sometimes this food is a bit too much for me, because they use that crazy cheese whiz-type stuff. But the pizza is OK and I'm willing to pack on 20 lbs. every time I eat here bc he loves it so much. His vegan favorites are the buffalo "chicken" sandwich and the soy cheese pizza. 

I did read a bunch of conspiracy theorists online who were saying Gianna's lies about being vegan. But trust me, I can definitely tell the difference between wanna-be cheese and the real thing. They ain't jokin' about it. All of the desserts are vegan, too, except for the ice cream. 

The restaurant itself is very bare bones as far as decor, but they have some pretty good/random concert posters and art work that looks like it was done by a 5-year old. Good location near South Street and the TLA.

It's not very different from other DoubleTree properties, if you are familiar with them and know what to expect. It's nice but not fancy. I am only writing this review because I scored a great deal on the room -- $40 on Priceline. I was looking for an alternative to staying in Philadelphia, which I needed to be near but is about 500x more expensive. If you are going to the Philly area and have some flexibility with your location, look into this hotel. That price is amazing, they have free wi-fi, it's close to the train station, the staff was really nice, and the bed was comfy. In-and-out parking in the garage is $15 per day.

Nice! Indoor sit down meal, family style! You dine overlooking the wildlife, as you take in a view of the Serengeti Plain! Grab a seat near the windows. 

Check this out, for under $20 per person you can get all-you-care-to-eat fried chicken and fish! Or, order from sandwiches, seafood, salads and kids' meals. What does the all-you-care-to-eat include? Both chicken and fish, veggies, mashed potatoes, fries, stuffing and gravy. Is it healthy? Heck no but it's delicious. And they will just keep bringing the food whenever you say refill. It's a pretty epic value setup. Just make sure you don't overstuff cause there are so many coasters to ride =)

Good airport option for a bit healthier  variety but nothing amazing. And, since it's "healthier" options, prices are high.

I just grabbed a sandwich and water, however they had good snack selection and I would have grabbed grapes if their weren't so dang expensive.

The staff was definitely preoccupied while I was in there and checking out so I didn't have the best experience.

I have been going here for a few years now to see tons of different shows and festivals ever since it was  Ford Amphitheater. It's a pretty good amphitheater. Great parking lot for tailgating, it's huge, also has permanent port-a-potties that are key when tailgating (unless you are a dude, u guys are so lucky). But that does mean it's quite a walk to the entrance and usually a bitch to get out after a huge show lets out. 

The vendors inside are quite expensive but that is expected at entertainment venues everywhere. The bartenders are usually really nice though. There are a good amount of bathrooms so the lines are hardly long. 

I have enjoyed shows from the pit, the seats and the lawn, everywhere is a good seat for sure. I do love me some pit though. Being in FL you have to be ready for the rainstorms too, not much coverage around if you are not in the pit/seats. 

Overall, I do dig the venue quite a bit!

It's so pretty!!! Is the staff nice? Nope! But, it's pretty :) Also, it's very easy travel. 

I appreciate the drive thru drop off zone but do with it was longer or wider, it's a bit tough during peak holiday travel with people driving thru like maniacs. (confession, I am most likely categorized as one of those maniacs) 

The only time I use this station is to hop on up to NYC and it's a super easy ride. It's 1 1/2 hours and you have time to sit back and relax while charging your phone in the outlet next to your seat, score! The seats are huge so you have tons of personal space. 

They still have an old school board to show departure times and stairways. Love the sound it makes. I could stare at the ceiling for hours too. The architecture is stunning. It's very open and not stuffy and they keep it very clean. 

I appreciate the shopping they have in here too, great spot to grab a book and a snack while you are waiting. 

A lovely experience. I truly can't imagine driving to NYC again.

Walking around and spotted some lovely jewelry and gorgeous purses so I had to stop in. Darling little shop with great things for gifts and for yourself. 

Cool items and for a good cause... check this out. Through the sale of their fair-trade products, Mushmina creates employment opportunities for women and men in developing countries. A company with a social mission, you have got to love and support that. They work mainly with artisans in Morocco and locally in Philly. 

I scored a gorgeous feather earring and unique string and metal bracelet. I love them both. Definitely check this spot out.

Home cooking inside the Brady-esque dining room, don't mind if I do. This laid back atmosphere with 60-70s decor invites you in to settle down and stay a while. 

For a girl who loves comfort food, this menu was absolutely drool worthy. I literally wanted to see a sample platter with one of everything listed... sadly this was not an option. 

We grabbed a late lunch at 3pm so the crowd was extremely lite. However, they still had a ton of staff which was nice to see. Our server appeared to have at least five tables and was not personable in the least. When we inquired about the extended time it was taking for our nachos appetizer, he finally then began to pay attention but I still had to request refills on our drinks. Thank goodness the food made up for the lack of service which was really a let down especially at a Starr restaurant where they are known for the service. 

The nachos were delicious. The perfect crunch to the chip and loaded up with toppings that had so much flavor. I was extremely pleased with them. Quite possibly some of the best nachos I have ever had.

For my entree I went with meatloaf, mashed potatoes and peas. Yes, something mamma would make on a Tuesday night and it was delightful. Not as good as my momma's, but she makes the best, but a close second. It was cooked perfect with awesome flavor. The gravy on top had a little kick to it but just enough and not too much. The mashed potatoes were velvety and the peas perky. I cleaned the entire plate. I wish we could have stayed for dinner and dessert too, it was all so good! 

I highly suggest if you are looking for a good, home cooked meal, stop in!

Dined here on Christmas Eve and it was very nice. Although I was a little thrown off that it was attached to the mall, it proved to be very nice. Our server was on point, she was lovely. 

There were 5 of us and we all gorged and it was all delicious. To start, the drinks - YES! There was this cucumber mojito type cocktail and I could have bathed in this, fresh and delicious. The Heirloom tomato salad to start was so flavorful. It was nice after I ate basically an entire loaf of their bread as it came right out of the over, YUM!

All the meat cuts are shown to you as they verbally explain the menu and specials, even a live lobster, felt so bad for him! I went with the filet and it didn't stand a chance next to me, I almost licked the plate. All the sides are for sharing, the two that stood out to me were the garlic mashed potatoes and sauteed mushrooms.  

We had the lava chocolate cake for dessert, yup! 

Overall great experience.

Yelp to the rescue! In town for the afternoon with my friends, we were looking for a place to eat before our trek back to Orlando. I yelped "lunch" and this place popped up and we couldn't deny the amazing reviews.

By the vampire costume outside we knew we picked a cool place. We chose to sit in the front near the large windows and comfy booth. We were immediately greeted by our amazing server and she was on par the entire visit! 

Cider you ask, YEP! Guacamole to eat for hours on end, yep! Just wish the tortilla chips were a little less wholesale club tasting. I went with the pork quesadilla amazingness and it delivered! I tasted Lisa D's German potato salad and WOW... delicious. 

This place was so chill that if I lived here, I know I would use this spot as my office. It was clean, the decor was fun and it was extremely open and relaxing.

Italiana!!!!  It's a lovely, quaint little authentic Italian hot spot. I have only been here two times and conveniently both on Monday evenings. What is Monday evenings you ask? Opera night. Yeah, the waiters/waitresses since opera... AMAZING opera.  About every 25 min they call your attention for a quick 3 min break where they let their talents rip over a subtle track and WOW... they are brilliant.  I was blown away with the talent.  They let you know that before you sit down as it is $4 a head on the bill. It's worth it, so lovely. Also makes for a great addition to a date night. 

It is BYOB so make sure you come with some good red and white, there is a wine and spirits around the corner! The portions here are ginormous. They suggest you split the salads between two people as they are quite filling.  I tried the arugula salad with fresh tomatoes and cheese and it was so delightful. Crisp and refreshing. We also split the portabello mushroom special appitizer that was stuffed with fresh crab meat and topped with lobster sauce. Can you say delicious? It was two servings so it was perfect for a sitting of 4. 

For the main course I went with the fish special. I have no idea what it was called but it was perfectly seasoned and topped with fresh crab meat as well and so flaky it basically melted in my mouth. The side was rice (eh) and carrots and cauliflower. 

I was so stuffed from everything else that I did not enduldge in the dessert but the ladies I was with said the dark side of the moon chocolate cake was to die for.  To give you an example of how good? It lasted about 55 seconds on our table. I literally looked down for one second to take the pic, the flash went off and BAM it was gone.  It was like a magic trick!

And our waitress... totally forget her name, but just a SWEETHEART! Has been there for 10 years and also is a singing teacher for local students and adults. She was informative, delightful and could sick her lil butt off!

Such a great lil place, you must stop in!

The Reading Terminal Market garden... well that's what it feels like! 

It just smells amazing, so make sure if you are anywhere near it just to sniff your way through. Yes, it's in the middle of the hustle and bustle of such a high trafficked, busy spot in the city but it is a great reminder to stop. And smell the roses. Literally.

I really crave these spots with amazing flowers. I wish we had more stops like this in Orlando. They come fresh from a farm in southern Jersey! 

One of their missions is stated as "We think the flowers you buy should be as healthy for the environment as they are beautiful." I love that. A company who stands behind their product and the environment.

No! Had to head in here with my mom so she could pick up a prescription. It was supposed to be ready after 10am, we were there at 3pm and it wasn't ready. It only took about 10 minutes to get ready but the lady working the pharmacy was so rude. She was talking to my mom like it was her fault and so cold. The system froze while she was ringing us out and did not communicate at all so we were left just standing there. Really? So frustrating.

Other than that, this is a really old, dirty and unorganized Walmart, a worst of the worst for sure. If you can avoid this place, please avoid it. Even if you are in the happiest of moods, this place will suck your soul clean with the smell, mess and just down right unappealing clientele.

Terrible customer service for sure and to me that is HUGE. On that note, it wasn't the worst experience I have had.

We made a reservation via a discount travel site for a night's stay last Wed. We were hitting up a show at the Amphitheater so it's a perfect location since it's literally a hop away.

Since the concert started early and we were driving from Orlando, we called the day before to confirm an early check-in and were told "sure, just arrive at noon and you will not have to wait more than an hour to check-in, there are tons of rooms available" so we thought we were good to go. Cut to the next day at noon when we arrive in the lobby and are told "Our system is down for maintenance so we can not currently check anyone in." Really? So it's routine maintenance and you didn't know this was going to happen yesterday? Fail. So we were told to wait an hour, which was reasonable... we will just go lay by the pool and relax... OH WAIT... The pool is under construction FOR THREE MONTHS. WHAT? Who fixes their pool in FLORIDA in SUMMER??? Huge fail. And on top of that, since we booked through another site, we did not receive the note that the pool was closed, which I think is also the hotel's fault for not making sure it was clearly stated. Also, when we called to get early check-in, they didn't note the pool closure. 

Well, one hour, ok, we will go grab a drink, check-in an hour later, we are told it will be at least another hour, so, being so passionate about customer service, I approached the third, yes third employee to discuss the situation and I request a Manager so I don't have to keep repeating what we have been through communication wise. The manager was clearly un-phased and did not offer anything to compensate for our terrible experience. Think about when you are stuck at an airport for a layover and they offer meal vouchers, nope not here. Not even a drink voucher. 

Then we check in again... YES, almost 4 hours we had to wait... so by this time it was regular check-in time of 4 pm... are you serious??? We asked for an upgrade since we waited so long, nope, just told "no." Jessica R was with me and she took the time to call home office and request that corporate be aware of the situation and she was assured they would contact the hotel. We never heard anything about it during our stay. Another customer service fail. 

So beyond the terrible customer service, which they had various times to try and recover from, the stay wasn't all that bad. Yes, there is smoke EVERYWHERE but it's an old person mecca because of the gambling and lack of nightlife in the area. 

The room was very nice but had a horrendous view, just the roof of a part of the hotel. The beds were very comfortable and a lovely tub. Other than that, pretty normal. 

I am still so underwhelmed due to the customer service and no huge selling points. Bad customer service makes me so sad. 

If I ever feel the need to stay at a Hard Rock Hotel in the near future, I am heading to the one is Fort Lauderdale!!! And if I need a place to stay in Tampa... this ain't going to be it folks!

Mmmm, fresh bread made daily. Yep, Yelp helped me here. Was looking for a healthy, hearty lunch, bam! Great Harvest it is!

Stopped in here on a road trip for a good sammie. Went with the BLT on honey whole wheat and it was perfection. I didn't want a ton of bread (which sucks because the bread is soooo good) so I took the halves and made a whole. Crisp bacon, fresh tomato and leafy lettuce. It was the perfect afternoon lunch. 

It's a very small location in a strip mall so not a ton of room for groups.

Cowboy. Californian. Veggie omelet.

All three breakfast meals left all three patrons very satiated.  Lucky for me everyone was in a loving mood after an amazing evening with Jane's Addiction so I got to try their meals also! 

The cowboy was an insanely hearty breakfast sandwich with probably some of the best sausage patties I have had to date. 

The Californian also hit the spot with it's heartiness even though it reads like a less-than-savory selection on the menu (I mean, eggs whites!? Really!?). 

I must say I enjoyed my omelet the best. Bear with me when I say I got the "veggie" omelet, it was just right.. Perfect amount of food, loaded with veggies and cheese, topped with avo and served with a side of fried potatoes. Perfect. 

Americano cafe gets six thumbs up.

I am ashamed to admit how often I frequent Starbucks but let's just say I can confidently state that this was the worst Starbucks experience yet.

Any business is prone to mistakes/incorrect orders, miscommunication, mishaps and bad attitudes but boy did we hit the jackpot with this location!

Staff was standing around gossiping when we arrived (yes, I could hear that it was just gossip).  There was one person ordering and two cars in the drive thru when we arrived.  We were picking up after using the mobile app and our order was nowhere near ready when we arrived.  That's ok, been there and have done and have seen all of that.  What irked me more was not only how long we had to wait after our "estimated time" (yes, I know what estimates are) but instead how everything started coming out with lengthy waits between each item?  

People who were showing up well after we did were receiving their items also spaced out and staggered, within their order and ours.  

Our grande coffee came out second to last and only about 2/3 full even though we politely asked for "no room for cream".   When we finally got our last food item (4 of 4) we grabbed our stuff and rushed into the car, as we were now late to get where we needed to be. 

First bite into that last food item we were handed and it was luke-warm and not to mention thrown together like a burger at a fast food joint.  I thought these things were already constructed and just needed to be reheated?  At any rate, when pulling the thing apart to place it nicely together that's when we confirmed that it wasn't hot (so obviously it had just been sitting there).  Yes, we kindly/gently asked if they could check if our sandwich was in the drive through line, about half way into our stay.

Hope they can get their act together.  I could hear the conversations going on around me, all negative complaints about their experience there.

I generally don't like greasy Chinese food, but was very impressed with China Panda! We used to order their take out at my work, and I craved (and still do!) the egg drop soup. Nowhere in Nashville competes with it, and I wish it was still so close to me. Great job China Panda!

With the end of restaurant week rapidly nearing, I had to make the most of my limited time and went on a double date with another foodie couple to Tayst. It was a great meal!

They had a good selection of food, we had a lot of different appetizers to choose from along with 5 main courses and 4 desserts for $30. Not bad Tayst!! To start, our table had the grilled 3 meat ravioli, fish sticks with mushrooms and sauteed melon, cheese plate, and summer vegetables. All of the appetizers were excellent, but my summer vegetables really stood out. They were fresh and had an excellent white wine sauce that was to die for... it was a little bit sweet and complemented the veggies perfectly. Great start!!

For entrees, the meatballs with potato gnocchi and salad were the hit of the table. But again, I was partial to my pork dish. It had veggies with a pork tomato reduction.. so great. It was rich (I believe it sat on a piece of pork belly) but cooked perfectly and the flavor was like a party in my mouth! The other entree was the Tayst take on chicken and waffles. Even though I am a Southern girl, I'm not much for meat and three style cooking. I know, blasphemy. But I feel that the butter and grease takes over and there is no flavor in most meat and three type dishes. However, these chicken and waffles were off the chart. It came with roasted watermelon and the waffle was savory and made with chicken in the batter. Crazy, huh?? Crazy delicious. 

After all that amazingness we got to try dessert and all of them were top notch. The s'more dessert was exceptional, my creme brule was different than your typical selection. It was rich and they had added a small line of raspberry sauce to give you a bit of a tartness with the sweet. Excellent! We also tried the cobbler and a vegan ice cream made with coconut milk! All of them were superb, but the table favorite was the s'mores, even though I still preferred mine :) You can't mess with perfection!!

I'm giving them 4 stars because they were out of THREE of the wines that we selected for the table. Then, they were out of the trout entree as well and we were not notified before our meal but when my friend tried to order it. It was slightly annoying, but not enough to make it a bad dinner. I also seem to remember this happening on other visits too, so work on that Tayst!

Great addition to restaurant week!

I was forced to stop and drop off a Comcast device, and silly me thought I would be done with my transaction in 10 minutes. HA! I was late coming back from lunch because everyone is stuck in a line waiting, no matter what you need. I wish they had a drop off station for people who don't want to haggle over their bill or cancel their account. Sigh. But at least the customer service was decent once I got up to the front counter and they got me squared away pretty quickly. I did have to suffer through a woman behind me yelling "order up" every time a rep was free. If you enjoy people watching and have a high tolerance for lines, this is the place for you. You definitely see a wide variety of people when visiting Comcast, but I will avoid it at all costs!!

I love ethnic food and am thrilled that Vui's is in Berry Hill and a healthy, fresh, lunch option! I ordered take out last week for a few people at work and had to fight to get parking since I went in during peak hours. It's definitely small inside, and I was very glad that I didn't have to fight to get a seat! I had the noodle bowl with the shrimp, and everything was very fresh and flavorful and a large portion! I like spicy food and got some chili sauce to go. The portion was tiny, and I had to fill up my container from one of the tables because I like a lot of heat! I agree with other reviewers that it is more expensive than my favorite Vietnamese options off Charlotte, but I love the freshness of Vui's and am going to be back again! I am excited to try more of the menu.

I was slightly concerned before my first visit to the Wild Hare because of some less than amazing reviews, but I have to say I had a great experience!

For lunch I wanted something lighter so I went with the grilled veggie farmer salad with the green goddess dressing and my BF had the cheeseburger. My salad was AWESOME. That damn green goddess dressing is so good and the salad was fresh and delicious! The cheeseburger was also great and I probably devoured more than half of his french fries. Oops. 

The service was ok, and the interior feels a bit divey, but overall it was a perfect lunch and just what I wanted! The pizzas look pretty amazing, so I will have to stop back in to check them out!

I had a great experience at Pancho & Lefty's one night before the preds were out of the playoffs (still sad about that). 
We went up to the rooftop and got a table immediately. Since we were at a Mexican place, we did what any normal human would do and ordered the queso and some adult beverages to start. The drinks were decent but nothing to rave about and the same with the queso. It's the yellow queso and my preference will always be the Southern white cheese dip always and forever. But it was decent and the salsa was great and made up for it.  
For entrees we had the adobo chicken burrito and tacos. The burrito was delicious and full of flavor! No bland, boring chicken here, it was seasoned so well. The tacos were also great, the fried pork was good but the ground beef was better. I don't even like ground beef and I was raving about it! Overall I was impressed with this Mexican joint downtown and look forward to exploring more of the menu. I only docked them for just OK drinks and the queso, but the food was an A+!

Sweet sweet restaurant week. You are such a danger to the comfort level of my pants, but damnit I never can say no to it...

Stopped in for dinner and despite having a completely packed parking lot, the tables were not full so we were able to sit in the dining room. Sweet. We ordered some wine and my BF had the "Sideways" Wine Flyte with a selection of pinots. Delicious. I had a lovely glass of Cabernet Franc. I swear we get the same waiter every time, Todd, and he's exceptional. He knows the menu and checks up on you. Perfect.

For the restaurant week menu, we mixed it up and each ordered something different. Starters were sunchokes and a soup, then we ordered the cauliflower and roasted chicken for entrees. For anyone who doesn't know, a sunchoke is more like a root less like an artichoke. I was confused by that but am happy to report that I adored my sunchoke appetizer. Hey, you are delicious! The butternut squash soup was pretty good, but mine was much better. The cauliflower dish was out of this world with brussel sprouts, shaved cheese, and breadcrumbs. I'm really digging Nashville chef's love affair with cauliflower. Who knew it could taste that good? My chicken was tasty, but I definitely tried to steal more bites of the cauliflower. 

Dessert was a chocolate panna cotta with some graham cracker type crumbles and an ice creamish substance on top... holy moley... it was amazing. Our meal wasn't exactly cheap due to the wine add ons, but we still got all that food and drinks for about $55/per person with tip. You know, not too bad. 

Flyte didn't let me down. Per usual.

I'd been curious to try this Five Points Mexican joint, and it was average. 
Stopped in with some friends on Sunday night for dinner and sat on the patio. I wasn't a fan of the salsa; it didn't taste fresh at all, it tasted like it came out of a can. The cheese dip was better, and we ordered a large bowl of it for the table. Then we ran out of chips and couldn't track down our waiter. Sigh. The salsa/cheese dip/chip paradox. I had a sip of a margarita, and I will say that was pretty solid, so not a total bust. 
I ordered a simple dinner of a bean burrito and it was good, but how hard is a bean burrito really?
Overall, it's an OK place, but I'm not rushing to get back. If your salsa isn't on point, that's 70 percent of the meal and not good for your Mexican restaurant. I also wish they were more attentive; the service should have been better.

This is one of my favorite places in downtown Nashville. The Nashville Public Library is absolutely gorgeous...the marble throughout, 3 stories of glorious books, and the most serene and beautiful courtyard ever! I love it so much! 
The first floor houses the fiction books, where I prefer to spend most of my time. Even though the place is huge, I find it pretty easy to navigate. The staff are friendly, and you can checkout on any of the 3 floors. Also connected to the library is Provence Cafe where you can get a delicious snack and coffee or tea. That's just spectacular! 

You should definitely check out the Nashville Public Library if you are in Nashville, even if you just walk through and check out the beautiful courtyard. They also have cheap parking close by that is the most affordable in town!

I somehow always end up at 3 Crow when I'm in East Nashville. On a nice weather day, I'm ok with that as they are able to roll up the windows. If it's hot or cold out... take me back to the West side!

They have a pretty tasty bushwacker, and I've sampled a chicken wrap from the menu that was good. 3 Crow hosts trivia on Thursdays that is fun and overall the waitresses are attentive and quick to get you a drink or some food. 

Of course the biggest deterrent for me is that they allow smoking inside, and smokers love it at 3 Crow. I'd say around 75% of the bar patrons are smoking (if not more), so just be prepared for that. 

They also have a patio outside that I discovered over the weekend (nice!). This is a welcome respite from the smoking inside.

You might be thinking "ice cream is ice cream." But Jeni puts rainbows and sunshine in her ice creams. It's heaven really.

This location has so many flavors and all the samples you want! My BF and I tried wayyy too many and opted to get one of their ice cream sandwich cookies. Holy cow. It was $6.00 but the two of us ate on it for two days. We had the salted caramel and peanut cookie and it was rich but SO delicious and the perfect treat. 

Just go try their ice cream. It's perfection.

What a great wine store!! They had a great variety and some bottles that I've never seen before! I really liked browsing through this cute but high end wine shop. And I've seen pretty much all the bubbly most places have to offer, but this one had some bottles that were brand new to me. Awesome. 

Only down side, I was the only one in the store and they were quick to ask if I needed help multiple times (just wanting to look on my own for now guys!) but it was still enjoyable and I'd come back!

Butchertown Hall is a 4.5 and allllmost a 5 star review...really close! I've only been here twice because it was a nightmare to get a table when they opened due to very high demand. Now that they've been open for a while, it's much easier to get a table, especially during the week. On my first visit I came with a friend and ordered the guac, a summer salad and the chorizo with pickles and mustard. It was all pretty middle of the line, and nothing really stood out to me. Before I wrote a review, I wanted to try them again when they'd been around for a few more months. 
I came back with a group of 3, and we had the char-grilled oysters as an appetizer. Again, they were just OK, nothing bad, but a bit heavy for my taste. I prefer fresh oysters myself, but they were fine. For my meal I decided to go light with a ceasar salad and chicken tortilla soup. My salad was great, the soup was just OK. However, my genius dining companions didn't make my mistake and ordered a half a pound of delicious brisket that was absolutely melt in your mouth good with a fantastic BBQ sauce. I'm not a huge beef eater, but my sweet inner carnivore.... it was wonderful! Our table of three demolished it and I realized why it holds the name Butchertown. Their meat shines like a beacon of delicious melt in your mouth light straight to your stomach parts. 
After my first experience I wasn't rushing to go back, but after my most recent meal, I am definitely going to make my way back here for more of their meat offerings. It really is phenomenal and worth your time. For vegans/vegetarians... I'd go elsewhere because I'm not blown away by their non meat offerings...

Restaurant week... Day 2. 

2 items for $23.00. Sweet! My dining companion and I had seafood on the brain, so we ordered the exact same meal. The mussel appetizer and then the bouillabaisse "seafood" stew for entree. I ate up the entire mussel appetizer, it was heavenly! Lots of garlic and a white wine/butter broth with a good amount of bread to soak it all up with. Yum. It hit the spot!!

The bouillabaisse was good, but the shrimp was very seafoody... and not in a good way. I looked at another one and it was not deveined. Gross. That would explain the potent taste. I liked the flavor of the stew and the other seafood was good, but I was also disappointed to see only one calamari in my dish. Bummer. Overall, the meal was good, but I was a bit put off by my entree. 

Note, they serve house wine by the glass for $6! Not bad at all. Wine list is great.

I freaking love Past Perfect. I have been more times than I can count, and it's always my go to place if I want a nice drink downtown away from a packed bar. I'll divide my review into two parts: 

Food:
They have food specials each night, and I always like the Alamo wrap and the chips and salsa. The bison burgers are also fantastic. On to the good stuff:

Drinks:
Past Perfect makes their own vodka infusions, and they make my world go round. They have a variety of fruit and veggie flavors and a couple weird ones too (ie: bubblegum-it's good with sprite, give it a try!) And they have a lengthy classic cocktail menu that I go to (the Key Largo!) most of the time. I love taking people here for drinks when I want a place away from Broadway so I can have an actual conversation. 

I think the service varies sometimes because they get a wide variety of demand depending on what's going on downtown. Most of the time it's great, but you do have those nights where it's super packed from a concert or event and they don't quite have the manpower for the number of patrons. Don't let that deter you from this great bar!

Table 3 is an excellent French restaurant in Nashville! 

Nashville is rather limited if you are looking for a French meal, so I'm so glad Table 3 took over the large restaurant space by the movie theater that seems to rotate restaurants frequently. I hope it is here to stay! 

The duck confit appetizer is incredible with capers and goat cheese on the side. It's cooked crispy and tender, and is just as good as I remember it from my first trip here! The cheese board is a great option as well, they feature different cheeses and provide great sides to accompany the flavors. The board included apple slices, buttered toasted baguette slices, red and golden raisins, and these wonderful candied walnuts. YUM. 

I had the pan roasted lemon sole with potatoes and my BF had the duck breast with sweet potato hash. The fish was very good, but the duck breast was incredible. The waiter told us the duck is smoked and you could tell in the outstanding flavor. It was so good!! For dessert we tried the salted dark chocolate mousse with these cinnamon cookies on the side. The perfect end to our meal!

Great service, great food, I'll be back!!

I know... a 5 star review for Comcast? I PROMISE I haven't lost my mind. 

But here's the deal.... about 2 years ago I had to return something to Comcast on site. I went to the Nashville location on my lunch break and ended up being gone an hour and a half (it was about a 15 minute drive) because I had to wait in line. I even tried to go at an off time (I think I took a late lunch) and it made no difference. There were 20 people in front of me (even to just drop something off) and I waited FOREVER amongst the weirdos around me. Sorry, but it's true:

http://www.yelp.com/biz/comcast-at-home-nashville?hrid=QR0dUKcuoIYKK63-e6dtMQ

Anywho, so I was bemoaning my upcoming trip to drop off my router, when my friend told me that they have a location in Hermitage off the beaten path that is not busy and luckily isn't too far from my work. So I drove a bit, and walked right up to a rep and was out the door in 2 minutes. YES. 

If you can make it out here without driving too far, do it. You will be extremely happy you did. The other location is an absolute nightmare.

This store is awesome. They have everything from jewelry, clothing, musical instruments and unique gifts. I am a fan!

I loved their greeting cards so much that I stocked up on 3 for the next few friends/family  members who have birthdays around the corner. Anytime a gift card has a quote by Johnny Depp on the inside, I'm going to purchase it! The prices vary... I found some jewelry for as cheap as $10 up to $170 and didn't look at the clothes much. I think it was the $70 scarf that painted the picture for me :) 

But the little gifts and books they had around were super cute and if I were a tourist, I would be all over those guys! 

Then I go to the register (it was definitely slow to get checked out) but she packaged my purchases nicely and told me to select a promotion from the jar. Hello immediate 20% off! I love it! 

Cute store, would be back for something unique, but wouldn't shop here on a regular basis.

Calypso Cafe... where the food is fast, cheap, and doesn't make me feel like I have to work out for 8 hours to burn off the calories from my meal! I love it!

This is a great lunch spot, the salads are excellent (try the Lucayan!) and the sandwiches and wraps are super tasty! Almost everything is $10 and under. Score! For sides, you have to get the Cuban black beans (I opt for no sour cream to be a bit healthier) and the bean and corn salad is made with this awesome dressing that has a great flavor. In fact, all of their dressings are tasty and I may or may not have tried to lick the bowl because they go too quickly. 

Calypso is great if you have dietary restrictions and the menu has lots of options for vegetarians (some vegan too!). The staff is SO friendly and are happy to substitute anything! Plus the fruit tea is the best in town. Make your way to Calypso, you will love it!

2 meals + 2 full glasses of wine for 24 bucks?? Yes please!

What's not to love about Noodles? You have a variety of choices and can customize your order to be American, Asian, or Mediterranean and at a great price. The menu is quite large and I love that they show you the calorie count! Though sadly, this means no mac and cheese for me! 

I ordered the med duo sandwich with chicken, mushrooms, red peppers, and feta. It was so good, and very low on the calories. I added a side ceasar and it was great also. My friend ordered the small whole grain Tuscan linguine, and while it was tasty, she was eying my meal over her own :) The smaller portion was plenty for one meal. 

But on top of good food, they also offer wine and beer! Sweet! I loved having a glass of malbec to accompany my meal. 

Great place in Green Hills! I'm excited to explore the other countries on the menu!

Ugh. Don't eat a meal here. Just don't. 

I came in for lunch and my BF and I decided we wanted a sandwich. I ordered the classic turkey with tomato, roasted red pepper aioli, and provolone. BF had the roast beef. We were a bit taken aback to see the chick behind the counter pull out two pre-packaged sandwiches from the mini fridge. Appetizing! She asked if we wanted them heated up and we said yes. 

We waited a good 10 minutes for our food. And yes, I did say that these sandwiches were pre-packaged. When they arrived they were hot, but the old lettuce was very soggy and gross. They were both extremely greasy as well. 

The only reason I'm giving them 2 stars is that the coffee and desserts looked very appetizing. They have a nice display case with cookies, cakes, and other treats, and they looked quite good. I'd give those a try but will never order a sandwich or a full meal here again.

Mmmm Sunday brunch. One of my favorite meals in the whole world, and Copper Kettle offers a fantastic brunch buffet on Sundays ONLY. For $17.25 you can stuff your face with cold salads, your typical breakfast fare (bacon, eggs, biscuits, gravy) as well as carved meats, omelets, and desserts. They also had a special omelet and  waffle of the day that was out of this world. Yum! The other items were rather hit or miss on the buffet line, and it's quite tight in there to get in and out of line. We came during the end of brunch and had no problem, but I could see it being an issue quite quickly with a bigger crowd. 

I love this location with the views of downtown and a very nice patio dining area. However, the awning that did cover the porch blew away and they have been unable to replace it. So beware if you are sitting outside on a sunny day as it can be hot even if it's pretty out temperature wise. 

Our waiter was very nice and personable. I have two complaints that made me not blown away by my experience, the coffee was incredibly weak and nothing on the buffet line was labeled. I wish that they would list what we were enjoying; especially for people who may have dietary restrictions.

After my second great experience at F Scotts I'm going for it and giving them the elusive 5 stars! 

First of all... the atmosphere is just incredible. There is a full jazz bar to the left with killer music and they often have a singer present to seduce you into a drink at the bar. Awesome! Go to your right and you have a lovely upscale restaurant where you can hear the tunes drifting down the hallway. Visiting here is such a great time!

But I'm here to talk about the dinner, so here goes. On this trip, we did not opt for appetizers, but I have had the pleasure to devour the tomato bisque with a mini grilled cheese on top in prior visits. Hello delicious! We actually had the same waiter this weekend that we had on our first visit, and he was just as friendly and personable as I remember, (his name is Matt) and even though we did not order appetizers, he brought us a complementary mini fried green tomato bite with a corn salad because "he didn't want us to be bored while we waited for our meal."  It was excellent, and I thought a great way to show us first class service. 

For entrees, I had the sole with vegetables in a roasted red pepper vinaigrette. It was exceptional! I ate every last bite! The table also had the pork chop with jalapeno and cheese grits as well as the polenta vegetarian entree. We all were left wanting more after the food ended. 

But the service really went above and beyond and I'll tell you why. My BF forgot to bring my Nashville Original gift certificate of $50 off the meal with us, and they were nice enough to credit the $50 without having the print off in hand (they are strict about having the actual paper). I really appreciated that they went that extra step when they didn't have to (and I would have understood!). 

I cannot wait to return to F Scotts to support a local restaurant with exceptional service!

Sorry Soulshine, I wasn't impressed with you.

Coming in on a Friday night, I was surprised to get a table immediately and had high hopes after a good start. They were busy inside, but not packed and I really liked the big open restaurant and nice patio. Our waitress started off friendly but when it took a while to get our drinks and order, I should have known we were in trouble. She was very frazzled early on; not sure if she was just new or had too many tables or what, but she came over in a panic saying she couldn't take our order because she set down her book somewhere. Um, OK?  

Once we were able to order food, we ordered the tamales and hummus to snack on, then the mushroom pizza as an entree. The tamales were ground beef and spicy, and the best thing we ate. The hummus was decent but had an olive tapenade that overpowered the hummus. I didn't love it. The pizza was middle of the line, OK, but not amazing either. 

I would probably have given them an OK rating, but trying to get the bill and get it correctly was a CHORE. We were still enjoying our drinks and our bill was brought to the table. Um... we hadn't asked for the check and were going to use a ScoutMob coupon for half off. Plus our waitress added on a drink that wasn't ours. When we asked to use the coupon, our waitress gave us an attitude and said "it's going to take me a minute to redo it." Um, we get that but we would have told you about the coupon if you had asked if we were ready for the check. Sigh. The "minute" turned into 20. We waited and waited for our check, and when we FINALLY got it, (and it was still incorrect) we just paid and bolted for the door. It wasn't worth trying to fix.

I'm not sure I'll be back to Soulshine. If the food was better I might be tempted, but with middle of the line food I think I'll pick somewhere else next time.

I feel that I've faced the same dilemma that most Eliters have faced; we remember the killer Elite event at Mason's and long for that same food, service, and experience. There's just something that has fallen slightly flat though on second go arounds....

Mason's was my first meal of the New Year...unless you count the cold pizza at 2am after celebrating that night, but I digress, I'm gonna count regular ol' Mason's for that. 

Obviously my BF and I were not feeling in TIP TOP shape; (ie... I somehow managed to throw on a hoodie and brush my teeth, but yesterdays make-up MIGHT have still be on my face.. I cannot confirm or deny. So its around noonish and we walk up to the hostess. She's in a sous chef jacket and was out of her element. Not sure why she was up there greeting customers? But whatever, she told us they'd be serving brunch that day even though it was a Wednesday, and due to our hungover state, we decided to go casual in the bar area. 

The bartender hands us the regular menu and we ask if she has the brunch menu. "Oh we aren't serving brunch." According to the sous chef you are? So she went and asked and confirmed that they were serving brunch. Ok, cool. I've been raving about the crab cake corn dogs, so we ordered those asap and then had some questions about the menu. The bartender was clueless and had to ask one of the servers.

She said that they had recently changed the menu and that was the cause for her lack of knowledge but yikes. It was just rather unprofessional and caused more delays in us ordering our food. I had the shrimp and grits and my BF had a sandwich. My shrimp and grits were decent, but SUPER rich and a bit sweeter than I would have liked. I've had better. The sandwich was great though, and the crab cake corn dogs were heavenly per usual. 

Overall, just middle of the line really. I understand that there's some transition with a new menu, but your staff should be trained before it's provided to customers. Also, slightly let down with the food this go around. Will have to come back at dinner and give it another shot.

Actual Brunch is somewhat a Nashville secret. Located at POP and slightly hidden away, it isn't quite the explosively popular brunch spot where you have to wait an hour to get a table. Sunday brunch at 11:00am was no problem and I quickly grabbed a spot for 4 people. 

Let's get the bad out of the way first. The blood orange mimosa. Don't get it. It was a tiny glass and I mistakenly thought the blood orange juice would be fresh. It was not. It tasted like blood orange syrup and was a dollar more than a regular mimosa. No thanks. The bloody mary's looked delicious. Go with that or get a different beverage. 

However... the food was outstanding. The portions were perfect and I highly recommend the vegan dish. It was so flavorful and filled me up without making me miserably full. I also sampled the omelet and it was very good as well. The food is unique and delicious, and not badly priced either! 

Definitely give Actual Brunch a try, just don't get the blood orange mimosa and you'll be happy!

This is a fun spot to visit when you are ready for a break from the lake and want to grab an umbrella drink or 5. The food is pretty rough though...

I really enjoy sitting outside and being close to the bar. They often have a band playing live and the owners are super friendly and helpful. I've eaten a couple items from the menu but just am never impressed. It's typical mediocre bar food I guess and nothing will blow you away. 

I do wish there was an outdoor section of the restaurant over the water, but I definitely feel like I'm in a different place when sitting on the back patio with a cocktail and that place is lovely!

When I worked in Berry Hill I was a frequent visitor of the original Vui's location so I was very familiar with the menu when I stopped in the Germantown location a few weeks ago. The space is so much bigger with plenty of room to dine and a good amount of parking. 
I grabbed my favorite salad; Vui's salad with lemongrass chicken and the delicious honey citrus vinaigrette as a takeout order. 
My favorite thing is to add the spicy chili sauce to the salad with a bit of the dressing. It's so good and fresh. A great lunch option without guilt! 
I enjoyed my order but the it could have been a bit larger. Otherwise it was really good! This is a much better option than the Berry Hill location and I'm very glad it is nearby!

When my fellow Elite Charline H. raved about the FJC in Franklin, I knew I had to make a trek down but had failed to do it for a number of months. Then the food gods smiled upon me and a location popped up in 12th South! Perfect! 
I first had an acai bowl in California a few years ago and it was heavenly. I tried the offering at Jamba Juice, but it wasn't close to the original. However, FJC came in and knocked it out of the park! 
They offer 6 different acai bowl options and it was tough to decide which to choose. I ended up stealing the Big Island from someone else on accident and it was so good (if you are a peanut butter fan). We also sampled the Bombom and Kona. Each one was different and had fresh delicious toppings! The medium bowl was perfect if you are hungry; it's plenty of food that leaves you feeling satisfied but not heavy. I love food like that! Also, each bowl has a recommended topping to add; do it!! They know what they are doing my friends, and you should trust the Franklin Juice Company.

El Rey is my favorite Americanized Mexican restaurant in Nashville!! By that I mean the Mexican food that is covered in cheese... aka not really authentic but the stuff I grew up on :) 

What makes El Rey stand out is that their meat is seasoned and extremely flavorful. Typically when I go to one of these places, the chicken is bland and has zero taste. Not so at El Rey! I have had multiple dishes here and I have not been disappointed once. I eat here on a regular basis, and they are consistent with their food and it being good every time. I'm not a big ground beef fan, but my BF gets it most visits, and he said it's the best he's had from a Mexican restaurant. The salsa is also great, spicy and they bring plenty of it! (I hate asking for salsa over and over!) 

The only reason they aren't getting 5 stars is because their margaritas are weak. Go for the food not the drinks, and you will not be sorry!

Having lived close by this location in my college years, I have a fondness to this Starbucks because of the memories, and will still stop by if I'm in the area. They have a decent drive-thru, and they make my latte right. 

Apparently Starbucks has updated their oatmeal to stone rolled oats that aren't quite as good and the baristas are still working out the water ratio. My oatmeal was extremely watery on my last visit, and I tried to bring it back but the barista told me he put in the right amount, but I had to wait 5 minutes... OK, it had been at least 4 minutes, but to give him the benefit of the doubt  I waited another 5 minutes... still extremely watery.

I get that it's new, but I wish he would have just gotten me a new one instead of making me wait another 5 minutes. Oh well, my coffee was still good and I'll be back if I'm close by!

I have been anxiously awaiting a visit to Burger Republic and finally had the perfect opportunity on Sunday morning at about 11:30 am. This location is not very large, and there are some long waits during prime dining time. 

BF and I were super excited to try them out, and we decided on our first go around to order the Tennessee burger and I ordered the Taco Truck on the house made veggie patty, which is a mixture of quinoa and awesomeness. Seriously one of the top veggie patties that I've had in my life. For real. Also, you can sub out any of their burgers with beef, chicken, ground turkey, or the house made veggie patties. As someone that is not a huge burger fan (unless it's In-N-Out) I LOVE the variety and options that they provide!! Wow. 

The list of burgers is crazy, and there's seriously something for everyone. We also had the misfortune of sitting by the milkshake window and I drooled over them being made. Those things are trouble. I resisted this time around, but next time I'm definitely going to cave. Especially since they offer spiked versions of shakes...Uh oh. 

Our waitress couldn't have been nicer, she discussed the menu in detail and was quick with suggestions and was delightful all around. 

Delicious all around. I can't wait to try them all!

I'm so excited they opened a Melrose on the West Side! I love the interior, and they have a great outdoor space for brews with a breeze when the weather nice! Great beer selection and a full bar menu with friendly wait staff. The food we tried on our visit was OK. We had the spinach artichoke dip, nachos, and loaded waffle fries. Nothing to write home about, but they did the job at 12:30am. 

Advisory: Cops are ALWAYS out on Charlotte anyway, and now they are even more vigilant with this new bar. Our friend was pulled over immediately (we were going right down the street) because of a "glaring headlight" (what the heck is that??). So be warned: the cops aren't messing around and don't drink and drive anyway!!

OK. I fail as a book lover and Nashvillian because I have lived here for a looonng time and had never visited Parnassus until 2 weeks ago! Shame. 

I hope that I have made this up by visiting twice within a week, one for an author reading/discussion (free and open to the public) and to shop for a book. I love this store! You can tell that the staff and clientele are serious about books and these are my kind of people. The prices are slightly higher than online, but not unreasonable. They have a lot of events in the store on a regular basis and I am definitely interested in attending some more of their book club events! 

I think the selection is fantastic. They might not have a gigantic selection of every book out there, but I like this. They have new and popular releases and offer a sturdy collection of local author books. Give their website a viewing or two because they have some really nice recommendations and reviews on books as well. 

Support local businesses AND real books by giving Parnassus a shot!

Midtown is the nicest liquor store in the area, in my opinion. When you walk in, classical music is playing and they just have that high end feel while browsing. They also know what the hell they are talking about people!

They have a fabulous liquor and wine selection, and are eager to offer a suggestion or opinion on what they carry. Complaints... they aren't the most cost efficient place in town (though not crazily so, just noticeable) and since times have been a bit tighter financially for me lately, I feel like a bit of a bum shopping here for my box o' wine or cheap selections. 

You know what I mean. I actually wanted a boxed wine recommendation (I prefer bottles but you've gotta do what you gotta do) but I noticed I wasn't approached once when I was in that area, whereas other sections will get you some customer service. Oh well, I guess it was less embarrassing to just grab my box and get the heck out of there before I was judged too harshly. 

But I do love shopping here, especially if I can afford something of the nicer variety!

The anticipation of Milk & Honey has been building for literally years, and they finally opened with a lackluster impression. 
We came in for lunch and they did an excellent job with the space. It's very pretty and open with great design. 
Our waitress seemed a bit spacey and knew hardly anything about the menu, but it was only their second day open so I try to give some slack for new restaurants. However, she really should have been able to speak to the menu. We started off with the pastrami poutine and it was good but very rich. However, it was a good dish if you are wanting something substantial. Unfortunately that's about where the good ended. 
I had the turkey and brie sandwich with kale salad, and my BF had the fried chicken sandwich with farro salad. 
My turkey sandwich was not good. It came with fig jam that was way too much jam and leaked onto the outside which made my hands extremely sticky. Overall it was heavy and the flavors didn't meld together at all. The kale salad had too much dressing on it and the fried chicken sandwich was bland. I enjoyed the farro salad at least. My latte was good, but small and the honey latte was way too sweet, but I guess that comes with the order. 
The menu was promising and I was so excited for this place to open, but it was a let down after two years of waiting.

I have a love/hate relationship with the Bridgestone arena. 

I LOVE going to see hockey games here, I hate seeing concerts here! I understand that there are some musical groups that require a large venue for their popularity and/or stage show, but it never sounds very good to hear a live performer at this venue! The only redemption for live shows at Bridgestone is if you have seats on the floor. I have found that that helps improve the quality of the sound and experience. 

The food is horrid, bordering inedible, but if you are desperate I'd stick to popcorn. I've somehow made the mistake of eating here twice with the same results. Gross. 

Parking is pretty nuts unless you want to walk a ways, and most of the garages fill up for big events so be mindful of that... traffic is the same deal. 

Overall, great for sports not for music! :)

Maybe I ordered wrong, but after my first visit I can't say this will be in my rotation when I'm craving a trendy acai bowl.... 
I stopped in and they weren't too busy (four people in line ahead of me) and it still took me about 20 minutes to order and get my bowl which seemed like a long time. The menu was interesting since they offer other kinds of fruit bowls in addition to the traditional acai bows and smoothies. I decided to be creative and ordered the kale bowl which was blended with fruit and came with granola and honey on top. My BF ordered smarter and got the beach bowl which is one of their best sellers and added peanut butter for an extra charge. Note that the toppings cost extra here which explains why the bowls are more affordable at $7.95 each. I have to stay... my kale bowl was watery and lacked flavor. I also didn't love the granola they used. I wondered if my error came from ordering kale, but I tasted my BF's best seller and it definitely wasn't up to par with Juice Nashville or Franklin Juice Company. Both were quite bland and seemed to be more ice than fruit. 
I was starving and it was a good sized bowl, especially for the price, but I have to say that it left much to be desired. I'll probably give them a few months before giving them a second chance.

What a lovely, unique spot for an Italian dinner! I came to Mangia with a group of fellow foodies and this was perfect for a large party! For $50.00 on the weekends you get a full 6 course experience complete with dancing (and its mandatory). They offer affordable wine and we settled into a lengthy dinner experience. 
Highlights: 
The focaccia with olive oil was the first item I tried and one of my favorites. It was perfect! I also loved the scallops, rigatoni with butternut squash, sage, and brown butter. I couldn't stop eating it! The herb crusted pork loin was a home run as well, and the cappuccinos with our donuts didn't disappoint either. I wasn't such a fan of the short rib pasta or the risotto cakes (very bland), but the good thing about this experience is it's family style, and you get to try a bit of everything and if you aren't a fan of one item, another heaping dish is right behind it for you try! 
The staff was absolutely incredible and fun, and you can tell that this isn't just a restaurant, it's a passion for them! I appreciated all the work they put into making our meal an experience.

Winner's is hands down my favorite place to karaoke in Nashville.

While there are some aspiring country music singers scattered throughout, I feel more comfortable singing my random crazy songs here with a group of friends. A lot of downtown karaoke bars are 80% amazing singers, 20% random drunk people. I like that I don't feel that I'm the only bad singer out there when I visit Winner's! 

Plus, you never know who you will run into at Winner's. One night a random dude came in and sang "Friends in Low Places" with someone from our group who was on stage; it turns out the guy is a well known songwriter in Nashville, and he WROTE that song. Wow.

The prices are reasonable and you are sure to meet some new friends! Plus I love the patio out front and the randomness that ensues! 

Note: karaoke is only on Friday and Saturdays :)

After seeing some seriously beautiful interior photos from Eater and Yelp, I was waiting for the right opportunity to give Caviar & Bananas a shot, and was happy I decided to come in on a Sunday for brunch. 
It was extremely hot outside and we made the mistake of walking here from our condo (not my smartest idea). So were were both miserable when we came in (bless you air conditioning). The restaurant is split up into cold items and lunch foods and warmer meals and coffee on the other side. Of course for brunch the coffee/hot food was the busiest and had a long line (though nothing compared to Biscuit Love). It took us around 10 minutes to get through the line and order our food, which I consider pretty amazing for peak brunch time on Sunday without a reservation. I ordered the avocado toast with one fried egg and my BF had the fried chicken biscuit with gravy. We each had coffee and lucky for me they had just started serving frose (rose with watermelon puree and vermouth). It was delicious, refreshing, and not sweet at all which is how I like my rose. The coffee was strong and delicious and came out pretty quickly after ordering it. The drinks were really on point. Our entrees came out on paper plates and we had to use plastic silverware. This was really confusing. The ambiance is sleek and upscale, so this was quite a bit of a turn off and left something to be desired. It's also difficult to eat a messy fried chicken biscuit with gravy using a flimsy knife and fork. Also my avocado toast looked slopped on the plate. I thought that was again weird for a nice establishment. Especially when the total cost with tip was $32.00 (I did get alcohol but still). 
However, what the food lacked in visual appeal more than made up for in taste. Both dishes were very good. I would leave the egg off the toast next time, but it was still fresh and tasty. We sampled the jalapeno grits which sounded amazing but were pretty forgettable. 
We had a nice experience here overall, and I really want to come back and check out their cheese plates and wine in the evening.

I love Tavern. They have exceptional cocktails, killer food, and an ambiance that can't be beat! I foresee many a dollar of mine being spent here....

It gets VERY busy, and on Sunday when I stopped in with a friend it was no exception. Luckily, there were two seats at the bar, so we snagged them and sat down. After drooling over another customer's plate of mussels, I decided I had to get them. White wine with bacon, leeks, and a piece of "dippy" bread? Um score. My friend had the chicken chimichanga, and it was cheesy but still full of flavor and amazing! 

But let's talk cocktails, something that really gets my engine running and Tavern hit the mark.

The red sangria was pre-mixed and topped off with some bubbly. It was a good sangria, but not over the top good. However, my balsamic martini with stoli, strawberry puree, and a splash of balsamic syrup?? Creative and delicious! I will be ordering the drink again and again!
